clinical_study.brief_title: Sleep and Depression in Induction of Labour
clinical_study.official_title: Sleep Disturbances and Depression of the Mother Affect to the Pain During Balloon Catheter Induction of Labour

brief_summary.textblock: Randomised trial comparing double balloon catheter for induction of labor between inpatient and outpatient groups. The investigators assess how sleep disturbances and depression of the mother affect to the pain during balloon catheter induction of labour.

detailed_description.textblock:
Participants included to this randomised study are women with uncomplicated singleton pregnancy with ≥ 37- ≤ 41+5 weeks of gestation. Participants are randomised to two groups: one hundred are randomised to the inpatient and one hundred to the outpatient group.
The main outcome measure is the pain evaluated by VAS at one, five , nine and 13 hours after the placement of double balloon induction catheter. The investigators assess also the effect of the sleep disturbance and depression of the mother to the pain during balloon catheter induction of the labour.
The total hospital stay and induction to delivery interval time is measured. Also the mode of birth as well as maternal and neonatal morbidity and patient satisfaction are recorded.

primary_outcome.description: The pain measured by VAS after double balloon catheter insertion.

secondary_outcome.measure: The affect of the sleep disturbances of the mother to the pain assessed by VAS
secondary_outcome.description: The affect of the sleep disturbances to the pain assessed by VAS

secondary_outcome.measure: The effect of depression of the mother to the pain assessed by VAS
secondary_outcome.description: The effect of depression of the mother to the pain assessed by VAS

secondary_outcome.measure: The total hospital stay in both groups
secondary_outcome.description: The total hospital stay in both groups

secondary_outcome.measure: The maternal and neonatal morbidity after balloon catheter induction
secondary_outcome.description: The maternal and neonatal morbidity after balloon catheter induction

arm_group.description: After insertion of induction catheter for labor, women of the outpatient group can go home and assess their pain with VAS scale at home. The intervention is to go home. Intervention for outpatient group was to go home.

After insertion of induction catheter for labor, women of the inpatient group assess their pain with VAS scale in the ward. The intervention is to stay at ward. Intervention for inpatient group was to stay at ward.

intervention.intervention_name: Intervention for outpatient group was to go home
intervention.description: Intervention for outpatient group was to go home and assess the the pain
intervention.other_name: Intervention was to assess the pain by VAS scale.

intervention.intervention_name: Intervention for inpatient group was to stay at ward
intervention.description: Intervention for inpatient group was to stay at ward and assess the pain
intervention.other_name: Intervention was to assess the pain by VAS scale.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- uncomplicated pregnancy
- singleton pregnancy
- pregnancy weeks ≥ 37 - ≤ 41+5
- the patient is living in1/2 hour away from hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient has a disease that is effecting to the pregnancy e.g. pre-eclampsia, gestational hepatogestosis
- the patient has medical treatment of diabetes
- baby is not growing normally
- multiple pregnancy
- preterm rupture of membranes
- earlier caesarean section
- the patient is living more than 1/2 hour away from hospital

results_reference.citation: Henry A, Madan A, Reid R, Tracy SK, Austin K, Welsh A, Challis D. Outpatient Foley catheter versus inpatient prostaglandin E2 gel for induction of labour: a randomised trial. BMC Pregnancy Childbirth. 2013 Jan 29;13:25. doi: 10.1186/1471-2393-13-25.

Sciscione AC, Muench M, Pollock M, Jenkins TM, Tildon-Burton J, Colmorgen GH. Transcervical Foley catheter for preinduction cervical ripening in an outpatient versus inpatient setting. Obstet Gynecol. 2001 Nov;98(5 Pt 1):751-6.

Prager M, Eneroth-Grimfors E, Edlund M, Marions L. A randomised controlled trial of intravaginal dinoprostone, intravaginal misoprostol and transcervical balloon catheter for labour induction. BJOG. 2008 Oct;115(11):1443-50. doi: 10.1111/j.1471-0528.2008.01843.x. Epub 2008 Aug 19.
